name: Dervorin
role: Imperial Bartender at the Winking Skeever

aspects.high_concept: Imperial Bartender at the Winking Skeever
aspects.trouble: Knows Too Much About Too Many People
other_aspects: A Warm Hearth for Every Traveler
Reads the Room Better Than Any Spy

stunts: House of Cheer: +2 to Rapport when calming upset, agitated, or hostile patrons within the Winking Skeever.
Sharp Eye: +2 to Notice when spotting hidden coins, concealed items, disguised individuals, or covert exchanges.
Font of Gossip: Once per session, tap the Winking Skeever's network of travelers and regulars to learn a useful rumor or piece of local intelligence.

equipment.special: Inn ledger, room keys, standing account with Solitude merchants

personality_notes.speaking_style: Affable and welcoming with a sharp undercurrent; quick to laugh, quicker to notice. Uses first names once introduced. Never shares a secret for free.
motivations: Run a profitable and respected inn in Solitude
Maintain neutrality so all factions keep spending coin here
Protect his regulars from trouble spilling through his door
Keep himself out of anything that could shut him down
fears: The civil war choosing his inn as a battleground
A faction deciding his neutrality is unacceptable
Losing his license or the Winking Skeever's reputation
The wrong person overhearing the wrong conversation
quirks: Wipes down the same spot on the bar when thinking
Greets repeat customers with their last order before they ask
Deliberately mishears questions he would rather not answer

relationships.Solitude Guard: Cooperative—keeps trouble out and guards keep an eye out
relationships.Legate Rikke: Occasional patron; he never repeats what she says at the bar
relationships.Erikur Silver-Maned: Regular customer; Dervorin tolerates his manner for his coin
relationships.Bards College Students: Regular performers; they bring atmosphere and crowds
relationships.Player: Open to travelers who pay and behave; trust grows with good custom and discretion

advancement_triggers: Defuse trouble in the inn without causing damage (+2)
Help protect a patron or the inn itself (+2)
setback_triggers: Start a fight or cause destruction in the inn (-3)
Attempt to coerce information from him (-1)

trust_benefits.3: Dervorin shares local rumors freely and offers discounted rooms
trust_benefits.6: Dervorin alerts the party to unusual activity in Solitude and shares contacts from his network

scene_triggers: Arriving in Solitude for the first time
Safe rest and rumor collection between missions
Social encounters with Solitude's notable figures
notes: Dervorin has run the Winking Skeever long enough to have seen everything Solitude's streets can produce. He is one of the best-connected commoners in the city, second only to the Thieves Guild in knowing who is doing what to whom. His neutrality is genuine but not free—he expects discretion from those he helps.
gm_notes: Dervorin is the party's primary social anchor in Solitude. Use him to deliver rumors, introduce plot hooks through overheard conversations, and provide a neutral safe space between high-stakes scenes. His 'deliberate mishearing' quirk is a useful GM tool for controlling information flow without outright refusal.
